description: September 14, 2020: With Bulletin N. 262, the Italian Ministry of Health announced that the Italian Minister of Health, Roberto Speranza, has attended the 70th session of the WHO Regional Committee for Europe (RC70), organised by the WHO Regional Office for Europe, on September 14 and 15, 2020. Representatives of 53 countries in the WHO European Region have attended. Representatives of WHO partners such as United Nations agencies and other intergovernmental organisations and regional networks, were also present. Non-State actors (NSAs) in official relations with WHO and regional NSAs accredited by the Regional Committee, have followed the webstream and had the opportunity to submit video and written statements in advance. The key health issues and future plans have been discussed, particularly on themes regarding the response to the COVID-19 pandemic and lessons learned from the pandemic, both globally and regionally.

- Grades 1 and 2 will go to school 5 days a week with normal classroom sizes and will not be required to wear masks
- Grades 3 and 4 will go to school 5 days a week in classes no larger than 18 students, and will sit at individual tables. Grade 3 will be required to wear masks only at recess, and Grade 4 and above will wear masks all the time.
- Grades 5 and 6 will be at school 2 days a week, in classes no larger than 18 students, and will learn remotely at home the other 3 days.
- All students will be required to bring in a daily health form.

description: Israel is resuming educational activities for the 1st to 4th grades for at least 4 days a week, under regulations.  it was decided that the number of pupils will not exceed 20 pupils per class, except for the following exceptions: The Ministry of Education will create an exclusion organ that will allow up to 10% of all classes to learn in groups of up to 24 pupils, prioritizing educational establishments in areas with low infection rates. Children from up to three regular groups from the same age group may interact, provided that the total number of children will not exceed 28. All pupils and staff members will wear masks at all times, including on the school bus to said activities and back from them, except when eating or engaging in physical activities. Activities will be held in such a way that each staff member could teach up to three groups at most, except for physical education teachers, and provided that they will wear masks at all times and keep a distance of at least two meters between them and the pupils. All pupils will wear masks for school, including pupils in the 1st and 2nd grades, and that the pupils will eat their meals outdoors, and if that can't be done, each pupil will eat at a separate table. On the school bus, a separation between groups will be maintained by means of a row of empty seats between the front and back of the school bus.

description:
In Israel, 21 Feb 2021:

"The 5th and 6th grades as well as 11th and 12th grades will go back to school in local authorities and areas designated as yellow and green according to the Traffic Light model, as well as in local authorities and areas designated as orange, whose index score is 7 at most and with a vaccination rate of at least 70% among those aged 50 and older.
Hebrew classes for olim will reopen.
The 13th and 14th grades in recognized technical colleges will reopen according to the same reopening model as in schools. 
Classroom learning activities will be held in technical colleges serving as a continuing education program for at-risk youth throughout Israel. 
The permitted quota for holding outdoor learning activities will be increased from 10 people per group to 20.
Youth movements and organizations will be permitted to hold outdoor activities in the same reopening model as in schools.
External operators will be permitted to enter preschools and schools.
Single-day tours will be permitted for educational programs cleared for reopening
Boarding schools will be allowed to resume pre-lockdown open program activities, in groups of up to 18 pupils, in such a way as to allow the unhindered entry and exit to and from the boarding school."

description:
In Israel, 21 Feb 2021:

"The 5th and 6th grades as well as 11th and 12th grades will go back to school in local authorities and areas designated as yellow and green according to the Traffic Light model, as well as in local authorities and areas designated as orange, whose index score is 7 at most and with a vaccination rate of at least 70% among those aged 50 and older.
Hebrew classes for olim will reopen.
The 13th and 14th grades in recognized technical colleges will reopen according to the same reopening model as in schools. 
Classroom learning activities will be held in technical colleges serving as a continuing education program for at-risk youth throughout Israel. 
The permitted quota for holding outdoor learning activities will be increased from 10 people per group to 20.
Youth movements and organizations will be permitted to hold outdoor activities in the same reopening model as in schools.
External operators will be permitted to enter preschools and schools.
Single-day tours will be permitted for educational programs cleared for reopening
Boarding schools will be allowed to resume pre-lockdown open program activities, in groups of up to 18 pupils, in such a way as to allow the unhindered entry and exit to and from the boarding school."
